name: Ben Rappaport
bio:
📺 INVENTING ANNA, MODERN LOVE, FOR THE PEOPLE, MR ROBOT, YOUNGER, OUTSOURCED
🎭B’way: @goodnightoscar, @fiddlerbroadway & Picnic

social_posts.post_text: Got this from @broadwaydirect! Here’s a little taste of our beloved @goodnightoscar. Come see us! #goodnightoscar
Oscar and Jack! Working with @seanhayes on @goodnightoscar has been nothing short of a dream. From Chicago to Broadway. Extremely grateful for this amazing cast mate and friend! #goodnightoscar

A few more from Opening. My particular faves are the 1am bodega shots. 🤘 
(📸 @michaelhullphoto)

Thank you @pix11news for having me on this morning. Had a blast chatting with @arrianee.lebeau and @danmannarinotv about @goodnightoscar, @itsmegankane, and Dan and me sharing the screen on Law & Order: SVU a few years ago!

Some truths about me: A) I’m WILDLY sentimental and B) I’m a nerrrrrrrd. I’m completely obsessed with these marquee pins from @broadwayupclose. They just released the full collection of pins of every Broadway theatre marquee. These are the three houses I’ve had the honor of performing in over my career thus far: the American Airlines Theatre, the Broadway, and now the Belasco. One of my favorite parts of the Broadway experience is getting to inhabit these beautiful buildings with so much history and lore. We make these spaces home for a period of time. Build families. Then, we pass it on to the next group of lucky inhabitants…and so the tradition continues. I have so many incredible memories in each of these buildings and am so excited I get to now have a piece of them whenever I wear this jacket! Thanks creating these truly special pieces @broadwayupclose!
The Good Wife reunion at @goodnightoscar tonight! So great to see you after all this time @juliannamargulies! Thank you for your kind words. ❤️
The front of the Belasco has been updated!

Lots of good friends/colleagues at @goodnightoscar last night! 1) @whoismrrobot reunion with @realchristianslater 2) Dream filmmaking duo @cswanson44 and @meswanson  3) Family @michaelcbernardi and @caitdono!! (Also, you can see my post show hair gradually progress into its non-jack state) ❤️❤️❤️
Happy Memorial Day wknd from some summertime dudez 😎😎
Love this photo @carrington_spires took of me as Jack Paar for @goodnightoscar!

More great reunions at @goodnightoscar yesterday. 1) Pals from my old NBC days @soulstealer007 and @therealkateflannery and 2) @emilybergl found herself in the middle of a Cary Agos/Carey Zepps sandwich with my The Good Wife bud #mattczuchry.

Backstage at #ham4ham was insane yesterday! A room full of legends, old friends and new. What a blast. @seanhayes dazzled on the keys. And @itsmegankane and the @andjulietbway crew crushed it! 
And, surprising nobody these days, the hair decided to do it’s own thing toward the end of this photo dump 🤣.
(📸 1 and 2 by @bruglikas for @officialbroadwayworld)

Happy @thetonyawards day! There are so many people to celebrate today (especially @itsmegankane and @andjulietbway! That’s the next post 😃) So much incredible work. I wanted to take a second to single out my friend and co-star @seanhayes. This pic was taken day 1 of rehearsals for @goodnightoscar at @goodmantheatre last year. It was clear to me moments after this photo was taken as we began to do the table read of the play that Sean was up to something brilliant. Even through the barrier of a KN95, I watched the spirit of Oscar Levant enter the room and take over Sean’s body. It was surreal. 

I was excited and scared about portraying a beloved and unique historical public figure. I had a million ideas in my head, logged tons of hours of research, but didn’t quite know where to begin with my construction of Jack Paar. After watching Sean’s magic, I asked him how he was doing it? He showed me a piece of footage of Oscar he used to get into character. There were a few key phrases he would repeat to himself in Oscar’s timbre that would allow him to enter the role. Then he explained that he didn’t really look or sound like Oscar in real life, so it’s about picking  some Oscar-isms, but never abandoning the truth of Sean the actor underneath it all. And BOOM! That was the lesson I needed to begin bringing Jack to life. That’s one of the first rules of making great art…steal from the best!

From Chicago to Broadway, I’ve had the great honor of not only sharing the stage with and learning from one of the great artists of our time, but getting to know a truly special human being. Generous of spirit, joyful, respectful, intelligent, hilarious. The kind of leader you could only dream of. The friend and mentor I needed at this exact point in my life. Rooting hard for you tonight, Sean! And like I told you before, you’ve already won by changing the lives of COUNTLESS people through your work on this. 

In case you don’t know, Sean’s journey of bringing Oscar Levant to life began YEARS ago and he worked tirelessly to make Good Night, Oscar a reality. Then, enter @quillsauthor62. Their collaboration birthed the gift of this play and then came the..(cont’d in comments)

Here’s the thing. I’ve known, from the first day I met @itsmegankane, that she was destined for Broadway greatness. And tonight, I get to watch her fulfill a lifelong dream. Performing on the @thetonyawards! Having been right by her side over these past few decades-through the incredible highs and low lows-the magnitude of this moment is not taken for granted. Watching Megan throughout the entire @andjulietbway experience has been one of the most life affirming experiences, and seeing her perform on the broadcast tonight is the icing on the cake. You belong up there, babe. And buckle up, cuz this is the first of a LIFETIME of Tonys appearances. I love you so much and couldn’t be prouder! And also, go team @andjulietbway! Honored to celebrate with you tonight!
Epic sibling/sibling-in-law beachside hang on Cape Cod. We’re all like 😎 and 👖.
Ollie V on his throne. ‘We are glad the Dauphin is so pleasant with us…’

There were several moments over the course of the entire @fiddlerbroadway journey with Sheldon Harnick I shall never forget. Chief among them was during my final callback. I was struggling with the long notes at the end of ‘Now I Have Everything’. After the song Ted Sperling, the music director, went over to the piano and plunked out that final phrase with me a few times to see if I could work my way through it. After a few tries, he looked over at Sheldon and said something like ‘What do you think, Sheldon?’ Sheldon quipped ‘What? Those long notes? Just make ‘em shorter!’ I said my goodbyes and thank yous, and Sheldon generously remarked how ‘wonderfully real’ my interpretation of Perchik was. He would make this comment to me every time we saw eachother throughout the run. 

Sheldon was an incredible force, a legendary artist, and a warm, kind, and witty soul. He gave me his blessing (and permission) and I’m forever grateful. RIP Sheldon. You’ll be sorely missed.

It’s mind blowing how many incredible people join us at @goodnightoscar on a nightly basis. Photo #1: I finally got to meet the brilliantly talented, warm, and kind @therealdebramessing. Photo #2: A lovely reunion with my @youngertv mother-in-law, the hilarious and delightful @kathynajimy! Also proven in these photos? I literally have like 2 shirts that I rotate through (that’s what happens when you’re in the middle of a run of a show 🤷🏻‍♂️), but I’m really glad I wore this one that night!
(📸 by @bruglikas for @officialbroadwayworld)
Skylight at Mom and Dad’s Cape House.
LFG 💪 #sagaftrastrong #sagaftrastrike

I kid you not- I love these photos @carrington_spires did for @goodnightoscar! Only 6 more weeks of donning the iconic brylcreem, suit, pinky ring, and mischievous flair of the one and only Jack Paar. I’m really gonna miss playing this guy. Come see us at the Belasco before it’s too late! #goodnightoscar

My first professional theatre job EVER was opposite @mssarahcatharinepaulson. She was so good to young baby me back then and taught me so much. It was an awesome full circle moment to have her at @goodnightoscar tonight. ❤️

Pleased to announce that I’ve launched my official website for my coaching business! Want to coach with me on an audition for your next gig? Want to book a general career consultation with me? Also, it’s never too early to start coaching those audition pieces to get into your dream BFA program or Grad school! Click the link in my bio, benrappaportcoaching.com for all your Ben Rappaport Coaching needs!
(And HUGE thank you to @michaelhullphoto for helping me build this beautiful new site!)
#benrappaportcoaching
Saturday Night On Broadway.
Love this amazing shot by @davymacknyc. The nooks and crannies backstage at the Belasco are so iconic and cool. Only 5 weeks left to come see @goodnightoscar!
We’re out here. HUGE turnout. Let’s F’n GO 💪! #sagaftrastrong #sagaftrastrike #sagaftra #solidarity

As @goodnightoscar winds down to a close (4 weeks left!), we continue to be visited by so many wonderful guests. Here’s me, @lornaluftofficial and @mattbomer. Lorna was so effusive and lovely. To be able to chat with her about how a huge part of my research was watching her mother (Judy Garland, folks) with Jack Paar over and over again was a real thrill for me. And how I was inspired by one of their interviews for my microphone bit in Scene 3 of our play (iykyk).
Matt is a legend of the Klein High School drama dept. We didn’t go to school at the same time, but he was known as one of the drama kids who really made it in showbiz. I looked up to him as sort of a North Star of it being possible for a kid from the Northwest suburbs of Houston to hit the big time as an actor. When I met him at an event back in 2011 in LA, he was so kind and encouraging to me as a youngster starting out in Hollywood. Reconnecting with him today was great and we reminisced about the good ol’ days in Spring, TX and at KHS Drama. 

I will cherish all these post performance reunions, meetings, and geek-out sessions at The Belasco for the rest of my life. ❤️
@davymacknyc comin’ in hot with these incredible backstage portraits at @goodnightoscar! This is post matinee, on dinner break.❤️

While we have a different anniversary now, August 2nd will always be our dating anniversary. Happy 16th (!) dating anniversary to @itsmegankane. Our relationship has a driver’s license! I love you so much and am so proud of the people we continue to grow to be together. Swipe to pic #2 for some year 1 early 20s cuteness ❤️❤️❤️

Here’s (most of) our gorgeous company celebrating our 100th performance of @goodnightoscar on Broadway yesterday. Bittersweet as we are now in our final 4 weeks. Couldn’t dream of a lovelier bunch of show-folk! ❤️

Happy Birthday to the style icon, amazing life partner, singular artist, and superhero dog mom that is @itsmegankane! You amaze me every single day. Last year was one for the record books, but I have a feeling this one is going to be the best yet. I love you so much! ❤️
Marie Antoinette vibez for @itsmegankane’s birthday last night 🔥🔥🔥🎂🍰🎂🍰

7 performances left of @goodnightoscar on Broadway. Just starting to hit me that this eventful chapter is about to come to a close. Getting wistful. So many thoughts, so many feelings…but we’ll save that for next weekend. For now, here’s another amazing backstage shot taken by @davymacknyc the other day.

Theres no place I’d rather be than inside the minutiae backstage at a theatre. The Shakespearean handshake with John at 5 min. Jillian ‘driving me to soccer practice’ at places to head over to stage left before my first entrance. The moments so intricately placed and acutely timed off what’s happening onstage. The clockwork- like routine of the post scene 1 check in with Emily at the bottom of the stairs to the dressing rooms. Assessing what sort of house we had that day. The rhythm of putting on my shoes exactly when I heard Sean over the monitor clinking the coffee cup with the spoon. Dreaming about upcoming travel with Lily as she applied my mid-show makeup. Waving at David on my way into scene 2. Me and Peter’s increasingly elaborate improv pantomimes behind the dressing room set before our entrances. Our daily cast hangs in Emily’s dressing room during the rhapsody. Marchánt and I high five-ing during the cymbal crashes of the orchestra recording. The goofy run into our victory fist bump with Alex after our final exit stage right by the SM booth. Dinner with Megan in my dressing room on two show days. These are just a few of the hundreds of moments I looked forward to as I walked through the stage door of the Belasco every day. This ritual is profoundly joyous and is the underpinning of what made @goodnightoscar so magical. Today, we close our run on Broadway and say happy trails to the most glorious theatrical experience of my life. The outpouring of love and support from so many of our friends, loved ones, fans, and colleagues has been unparalleled and is the evidence that our story touched the hearts hundreds of thousands of people. Thank you Doug Wright and Lisa Peterson for your brilliant artistry. For seeing Jack Paar in me, and gifting me the greatest acting opportunity of my career when I happened to need it most back in January of 2022. Studying and inhabiting Jack is the single most joyful artistic experience of my life. And thank you @seanhayes for your friendship, mentorship, and leading this company with grace, humor and generosity. Too much to say here, so I’ll leave you with a good old fashioned ‘Good Night, Oscar Levant. Wherever you are.’
Last looks on Paar and the glorious Belasco. (Last pic is a a few of us remaining company members bidding farewell to the building. 📸 by @msmarissarae)❤️

I’m sure you’ve heard by now, but @itsmegankane’s debut as Anne in @andjulietbway last night was ELECTRIC. It was truly the culmination of her life’s work so far up on that stage. Through Anne, she displays the entire range of her talent. Power, VOCALS, movement, nuance, wit, and vulnerability. Every corner of her personality is filtered through this role, and it couldn’t be more perfect. Toward the end of Act 2, there is an intense 2 hander scene between Anne and Shakespeare. When I tell you all 1,055 souls in that audience were absolutely rapt and hanging on her every word…it doesn’t do it justice. To see her commanding that Broadway stage with nothing but her sheer presence. The silence…it was a moment I’ll never forget. I’ve never been more proud of her and feel so fortunate to have witnessed the coming out party of a bonafide Broadway mega star!
(📸s captured by @michaelhullphoto)
Labor Day escape to CT with the family❤️❤️❤️
Happy 5th Birthday, Ollie! Mommy and I love you so much and the joy you bring into our lives is immeasurable! Now, go to town on those treats! 🐾
Out Of Office 😎

6 years ago, on a crystal-clear crisp Cape Cod afternoon, my best friend and I married each other. That clarity has guided us through the incredible highs and lows and twists and turns life has to offer in a 6 year span. Laughing with you, crying with you, changing with you, and aging with you makes the whole thing so much better. Happy Anniversary, Megan. I’ve never been more in love with you. ❤️🥂

Day 104 of the @sagaftra strike and we are holding the line strong. Never been prouder to be a member of this community. Second day back at the table. Let’s get a fair deal! #sagaftrastrong #sagaftrastrike #sagaftra

One day longer, one day stronger. As long as it takes. Great to see so many friends and colleagues on the line today, standing up for a fair deal. Especially some of the @goodnightoscar family! (Not pictured here, but including @marchantdavis and @tramell.tillman!) #sagaftrastrongchallenge #sagaftrastrong #sagaftrastrike #sagaftra

A huge thank you to @officialfrandrescher, @duncanci and the @sagaftra negotiating committee for working so hard for us. Congratulations to all my union brothers and sisters, who stood in solidarity for 118 days! Also, enormous thanks to our siblings in the WGA, IATSE, DGA and numerous other supporters for standing by us. Let’s get back to work! #sagaftrastrong
Happy Thanksgiving from our family to yours! In an increasingly turbulent world, I’m thankful for this woman right here and the life we’ve created. ❤️❤️❤️

Casual way to spend Hanukkah, huh? Today was the presentation of our week-long workshop of @em.weinstein’s staggering new play “Becoming Eve”, directed by the true theatrical rockstar @tynerafaeli. Not only was was this process a thrilling collaboration of some of the greatest artistic minds I’ve met lately, but it also put me in a rehearsal room where I got to spend every day acting opposite one of my true acting heroes @mandypatinkin. Mandy has been somewhat of a North Star for me as a performer and to get an intimate look into his process was an experience I shall not soon forget. After the presentation his wife, the great Kathryn Grody, approached me and said “You remind me so much of Mandy when he was your age!” 🤯 That statement will carry me through the rest of my year! (And no, I did not show him pic #3 of this photo dump…the side by side I took back during Fiddler where we are beard/Disney theme park T-shirt twins…) ENORMOUS thanks to Tyne for bringing me aboard, Em for this gorgeous play, @daynabloom and @brianlee_nyc for shepherding it into the world, @abbychavastein for her INCREDIBLE story upon which this is based, and this entire glorious company for an unforgettable experience. I truly hope the world gets to experience this story in the very near future! Chag Sameach and L’chaim! 🕎
Pic by @marchantdavis back in the early days of rehearsal for the Broadway run of @goodnightoscar.
Another brilliant one by @marchantdavis. Day 1 of @goodnightoscar rehearsal.
It was a damn good holiday party season. (📸 @avanoble)

End Of Year Thoughts…
I think my biggest take away from this year is the acceptance of the absurdity of our existence. I don’t mean this in a pessimistic or even nihilistic way, but rather an acknowledgement of what simply is. 2023 was a year of incredible highs and profound challenges. Rather than running away from, outsmarting, or defeating the inevitable storms of life, I’m gently training myself to stand directly within discomfort. In that, I’m finding immense power. I would even say ‘peace’, but I hesitate to use the word because peace is a dragon that we are programmed to chase, yet we never fully achieve it as an ultimate end. Instead, it’s an experience we come into brief contact with before we inevitably face the next challenge. Ad infinitum. Sisyphus rolling the boulder up the hill for eternity (yes, I’ve been getting into Camus lately…really digging him!) Forgive the perhaps reductive cliché, but it’s about finding joy and beauty in moment to moment living. That’s honestly all there is. And I’m re-framing fear. It is no longer the enemy, but rather a friend. Nothing more than an energy cowered from by way of viewing it through a societal and habitually negative narrative lens. Chipping away at ‘shaking my fist at the sky’ victimhood in all aspects of my life has also been fiercely rewarding. I recommend it! Now, let me be clear. The sheer act of typing this into text gives it the illusion of being definitive. I assure you, it is NOT. These are lifelong processes. The only definitive ‘truth’ that exists is the fact that we humans enter the world and exit it. How we frame what happens in the middle is completely up to us, and thus (I think) we get as close as we can get to any intangible notion of meaning. I look toward 2024 with great hope. Hope for deeper experience, knowledge, art, and love. What did you learn this year?

(📸 @ginoalephotos)
So excited we can finally share @itsmegankane has joined the cast of Smash! Look at the incredible company she is keeping! Couldn’t be more proud of her and nobody is more deserving. Broadway, baby!

So great running into @jennawolfe after all these years. She and Lester Holt interviewed me out on Rockefeller plaza on the weekend @todayshow back when I was a baby promoting Outsourced. She was very kind to me back then and I never forgot it. (Sorry, Jenna. My witticism account is overdrawn so you get earnest sentimentality 😜)

📺 INVENTING ANNA, MODERN LOVE, FOR THE PEOPLE, MR ROBOT, YOUNGER, OUTSOURCED
🎭B’way: @goodnightoscar, @fiddlerbroadway & Picnic
